PITHAPURAMYou are the son and wife of the 1st of us, Aritya is my wife, and the 3rd is the brother and wife.
Mandal, B. Kottur village, all that is,
that All that was built with money, and the said house was built in the name of Puli Simhachalam garu, paying taxes and other charges to the Panchayat under Assessment No. 270, and the said Puli Simhachalam garu enjoyed it with all rights during his lifetime without making any kind of written documents to anyone. On the date of 11-08-2022, all that came into our possession, including the vacant land, water reserves, common roads, common water The property worth Rs. 2,19,000/-, including all rights and interests, including roads, easements, etc., is given to you free of charge without any consideration from you, as a gift, and the property is taken into your possession on this very day as per the schedule. From all this, you should enjoy the said property as per your wish, and with all the rights of donation, sale and all freedoms, your sons and grandsons should enjoy it freely and freely. In this regard, we agree that, if any disputes arise due to our mutual understanding and mutual obligations, we and our heirs will resolve them at our own expense and will continue to implement this settlement document for you and your heirs in accordance with this.

and that the said property is the property of Shri. It is hereby declared that the property has not been assigned as per Government Act 9/77 and that this Settlement Document has been written to you with full confidence and trust. Accordingly, the agreements for the transfer of tax on this property have been filed in your name.
Declaration
1) We hereby confirm that there are no trees or gardens like coconut, mango, sweet potato etc., fish ponds, granite mines, minerals etc. in this property and we hereby declare that we will be liable for the payment of depreciation duty if any such facts are found to have been concealed herein.

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 21051 of 2024, dated 01/Jul/2024, executed by 1. Puli Papa 2. Puli Nagabhushanam 3. Puli Naga Chanti, in favour of Puli Lakshmi, (where as Donee is the Daughter in law of 1st Donor, Donee is the Wife of 2nd Donor, Donee is the sister in law of 3rd Donor), towards the property admeasuring an extent of 145.83 Sq. Yds, bearing house number 3-95, comprised in survey number 17-2, situated in B. Kotturu Village and Grama Panchayath, Pithapuram Mandal, erstwhile East Godavari District, now within the District of Kakinada, registered at sub-registrar office Pithapuram, is bounded as follows: North by: Ft 36 Panta Kaluva South by: Ft 39 House of Sivakoti Apparao East by: Ft 34 C.C. Road West by: Ft 36 House of Kongu Bulli Achchiyya
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
